We just picked up our Easter ham and the girls working there were so friendly and helpful! They were organized and very efficient! We realized that we might not have ordered a big enough ham when we did it online and they had plenty of extras to "save" us! Very great customer service!

Awesome Ham and Excellent service !! Thank you Kelvin for being patient and helpful with my daughter and I while we figured out our order for Easter dinner ! decisions, decisions LOL hope you have a Blessed Easter.

Didn't know they carried meals besides ham! Can't remember the name of the sandwich I got, however it was very good! Yelp offers free chips and drink with check in, however it was not valid in this location. The lady was nice enough and still took the yelp coupon :) I also ordered for my co-workers and was confusing them a bit, the workers were all patient and super friendly!  (This was on a Saturday)

This place is brand new and since the one on Wilshire in Santa Monica closed, we made sure we stopped by here on our drive out of chandler to LA.   The employees here were so cheery and polite! They were quick and knowledgeable. You didn't feel like you were burdening them by ordering sandwiches over a holiday ham.   We ordered a few sandwiches which were soooo good! I got a classic ham but subbed multigrain for croissant and cheddar for Swiss. Honestly, I don't think it needed cheese. The tomato was really under ripe but again, the ham was the star and they did not skimp on it either. They honey mustard sauce was overflowing on one side though and it looked like it was an after thought to add like they forgot and squirted it in the side of the sandwich ? Idk, it's not a huge deal. It made it sticky and really messy to eat but it was so yummy that it was tolerable.   My hubs got a turkey Bella. It was perfectly balanced. Between the pepper rings and sweet balsamic, to the ham and turkey with savory mayo.   I so wish we had one in Santa Monica. I may have to trek up to Burbank one day just to try something else.

Always a great meal and fast friendly service. I order the BBQ smoked Stacker sandwich almost every time. Bread is light and the sandwich is just the right size. Check in here, who knows, might get you closer to your meathead badge!

Came here last night with my wife to pick up the traditional Christmas ham. This location is brand new and thus very clean/organized. They have a set path for the line to make things easier to manage while also allowing customers to sample their different sauces/mustards prior to reaching the registers. Since it's only us two this Christmas, I was a little worried they wouldn't have a ham portion that was small enough. However, I was proved wrong! We were able to get a boneless quarter ham that was the perfect size thanks to the assistance of HoneyBaked staff. Not to mention, they did it with a smile and no sense of being rushed at all! Supreme customer service! Looks like I found my new spot for high quality ham.  PS: at the time of this review, there is no signage above the entrance yet. Just go a few doors to the left of the new Fry's Marketplace (same building) and you'll find it no problem!

I'm surprised I haven't seen or heard of this place earlier! I haven't bought any of their ham but their sandwiches are so good!   From the previous reviews, it looks like there might have been a new manager or something because the quality of the food is amazing! I have been back to the place almost 3x in one month and couldn't be happier! Especially when they have stamp cards!
I swear, this ham has crack in it...ADDICTING is an understatement, folks. Sheesh! Just go!

Every Christmas, this is where I pick up my bone in ham.  I always buy the ham with their split pea soup packets they have before the register so I can make split pea soup with the leftover ham.  There is always a line during the holidays but it goes fast because they have a lot of staff working on the register.
Gion is the supervisor. And she is AMAZING. great food and they honor Veterans Day also.

As soon as you walk in you notice a very clean well kept establishment. We were greeted warmly buy our cashier and he was a bevy of knowledge on the menu. He whipped us up 2 of the best sandwiches me and my employee had in a long wine. Fast efficient friendly and tasty would definitely recommend

The ham is great but the turkey salad is even better. Fast service and nice, helpful, knowledgeable staff. This is the first HBH store I've eaten in in the south so I expected them to have all the sides like they did at the one near my house in Northern CA and they didn't, but otherwise the place is awesome!!
Walked right in and picked up a Ham and some other items for Christmas for a house full. They were well staffed and very cordial we were in and out in less than 15 minutes.

If you want a great tasting traditional sandwich this is the place to go! My husband and I both ordered the Bistro Turkey and Brie - honey baked roasted turkey breast, creamy sliced brie, tangy mayo, dijon mustard, lettuce and tomato on fresh sourdough bread. We ordered the combo special which comes with a side salad and a drink.   The turkey was melt in your mouth delicious. There is no fancy restaurant or amazing presentations .... you come here simply for a great tasting sandwich : )

I ordered the Supreme Sandwich Tray, assorted chips and the Cookie Temptation Tray for a work lunch.   The order arrived a little earlier than expected but no biggie as it was just sandwiches that could be put in the fridge. Everything was awesome!  The ham is obviously my favorite on a croissant lol.  The snickerdoodle cookies were super delish too.  I pass this location on my way home everyday and have been into the store once or twice for a sandwich.  Great location, great delivery and will definitely order from them again.  Lunch for 10 which could of easily fed 15-20 for $100...perfect!

I just had the best experience here. I ordered a ham on Monday to be picked up on Saturday. It was a mad house there today. The line was going along the side of the building when I got there about 4 pm. First of all I was shocked at how fast the line moved. Before I knew it I was in the building and then at the counter. They were out of the 8 pound ham that I had ordered and instead of making me wait for one to be cut they upgraded me at no charge to an 11 and a half pounder. I was shocked to say the least. I work in customer service and although I would expect to be taken care of I rarely see it happen. This was a great move on their part. I'm a customer for life. I was also impressed to see that the woman behind the counter was able to make this kind of call without getting a manager involved. We were helped by a woman by the name of Litisha, I will be filling out the online comment survey in hopes she is rewarded.

First off, Honey Baked Ham is one of my favorite sandwich shops. I checked in on yelp and received an offer for a free chips and drink with proof of check in.   Their check in coupon has an expiration date of 2013! I obviously just checked in now right in front of you. I had a friend check in thinking maybe I just had an old coupon from forever ago stashed away, but his said the same exact thing.   Joy would not accept either of our check in offers after BOTH of us checked in right in front of her so she could see. Very disappointed that they would not honor their own active offer. If you no longer wish to honor something you are marketing then you should remove it or update it!

I rarely ever review on Yelp, nor leave a one star review. My guy and I were on a trek for a quick lunch spot around the area and we came about this place; I drive past it nearly everyday so why not? We go to order and this lovely woman, Gion, helped us out with the menu and guided us with choosing what was best for us. He got some kind of gigantic BBQ sandwich and a chocolate chip cookie. I settled for the Mediterranean veggie on toasted ciabatta sans the ranch, vinaigrette, and banana peppers but I added the tasty pesto aioli! Anywho, the lovely sandwich preparer had out food out quickly and neatly, but my bread wasn't toasted.  Slightly r.i.p., but no spook! She just warmed it up for me. I didn't receive a cookie and I waited at the counter for maybe two minutes as the ladies were chatting in the office and then my guy called to get their attention about the cookie. They said it was so biggie! And handed me a frozen cookie! How silly?? Didn't even warm it; just kind of put it in a bag and handed it to me. If that isn't crappy, I don't know what is. I could get better service from a group of goats. However, the service, prices, and quality was pretty nice, but I just wanted an unfrozen cookie. Thank goodness Subway is across the street.

When I pulled up today to get our ham for dinner tomorrow, the line was around the building.  I thought to myself, my gosh this is going to be an all day affair.  Within 15 mins I was out the door with my order and off to run the rest of my errands.   Honey Baked, you have this down to a science!  Great Job today!!! They had a ton of staff on board and were knocking it out left and right!  Everyone was friendly and doing what they were supposed to!  Walmart should cue from them!!! Staff up for busy days, get them and get them out!   Whoohoo!  As good as it gets!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yummy!

Stopping by twice to pick up a sammich for lunch, I have always had a good experience with this HBH. There are typically no patrons inside so the ordering process is fast as well as the sammich making process. The prices are fair as well. Kind of a hidden lunch gem if you ask me.  I also do corporate catering with them as well. The managers have been nice enough to work with my company budget and that helps a lot! Box lunches are the way to go for picky employees!

We ordered a ham fr our Thanksgiving dinner instead of buying one at the store. Payed 81 for the ham and it was dry as the desert we live in. Followed the directions on how to heat it and it came out of the oven dry. The glaze had all fallen off. Long story short extremely dissatisfied with the quality of the ham especially for the prices they charge.    Update: Less than 10 minutes after the complaint on the website I received a phone call from Tony Baca the general manager and he offered to replace the ham. We have received a new ham for our Christmas dinner. Thank you for the great customer service Tony.
Came here for a to go order for lunch. I got a ham sandwich and potato salad. Ham was melt in your mouth. Potato salad was ok, nothing spectacular. Restaurant was really clean!

It's towards the end of summer and it's hot - it sounds like a spiral sliced ham day! However, I'm just one guy...I can't eat a whole ham by myself...or can I?  Well worry no more ham (and turkey) connoisseurs as the Honeybaked Ham Company serves lunch or ham for 1.  I stumbled upon their store front while on a hunt for a Krispy Kreme following a bad day. I walked away with a ham sandwich and OMG it was like I was transported to the day after Christmas.    They serve turkey too but come on, it's called Honeybaked Ham, not Honeybaked Turkey.  Still, I assume that part is good too.  Sandwiches are so good that it's made my regular stop list.  The sides are standard sandwich fare: bagged chips and can soda but nevermind that - it's just that good.    Just a warning: it's takeout only but now that the weather has started to cool, you can enjoy your ham goodness in your car while on a lunch break.
Love this honey baked ham location. Staff is always friendly and her nice. The location is always clean and the food is good.

If you've never had "thee honey baked ham" you are certainly missing out! They have nailed down the best recipe. Don't be fooled by random honey baked hams available at the grocery store, you'll be horribly disappointed. You will pay more, but mark my words, it's worth it! My favorite part is the crunchy coating on the outside of the ham! The meat closest to the bone, yummmmmm! I went here to pick up my ham for Christmas dinner. They have a solid system down pat. There was a semi truck full of hams, they weren't about to run out! As I entered the store, there was roped off area to keep the line well organized. I'll admit, I was bummed to see about 50 people in front of me, but the line moved surprisingly quickly. I like that they have extra items available that you may have not thought about getting..fancy mustards, big sandwich rolls, etc.. I was disappointed that they were out of all side items but one - thankfully it was one we liked, Yukon mashed potatoes..but I was sad that that was it.. I suppose next time I'll go a day earlier..or perhaps they can have more on hand next time.

Never again. Came in to pick up holiday ham. Long line.... Caused by slow and dopey employees. Not enough registers to cash people out causes major confusion for the staff. Had several people BEHIND me in line that paid and walked out the door even before I could hand CASH to the cashier. What a mess. Not worth it. Beware! You'll leave frustrated and not in the holiday spirit.

Just had a D-Lish Tavern Club. First visit to a Honey Baked and I'll definitely be back. Not just because the sandwich was yummy (which it was...bread was awesome, thick cuts of meat, ripe tomatoes...) but the team was even better. Everyone there was super nice and helpful and they wanted to make sure we were enjoying our visit especially due to the reconstruction happening. In a world of waivering levels of service, these guys stand out as being awesome. Loyalty has been bought. Thanks honey baked team!

Place is terrible. There was one lone poor girl working there which made service insanely slow. Unfortunately we got our sandwiches to go and by the time we realized how disgusting they are we couldn't just take them back. I couldn't even force the sandwich down.   I understand "honey baked" is in the title but the sandwich was literally drowning in ooze. It managed to be extremely sweet yet somehow managed to have this sour kick that could only come from cheap dijon mustard. The layer of goo (honey) that was on this sandwich i literally think she took a soup ladle and just poured it over the sandwich. And the bread was this thin, flimsy, like dollar store crescent roll looking thing. There was like no bread to it. It was just crust. Hard to describe really. Good bread can make a bad sandwich at least mediocre, but they can't even manage to have decent bread.   It was honestly in the top 5 worst sandwiches I ever bought in my life. A chain sub shop would have been 1,000 times better, 3 times bigger, and couple dollars cheaper. You couldn't pay me to give this place a second chance.

I went early to avoid the crowds and I'm glad I did. They were already busy, but have a great system to direct the flow of traffic. They even have Sheriff's Deputies on duty? Really? Does ham really need a Police presence? Anyway, good food, free samples and staff was numerous and helpful. THANKS HBHCo!

Thanksgiving ham ruined by Honey Baked Glendale! I bought a quarter ham it was the driest ham I have ever had there was no honey or brown sugar on the ham. No juice anywhere for warming.  Tasteless ham is what you should call it. I'm from California and my last ham was purchased there was so good. Honey Baked of Glendale . $35 down the drain so disappointed.
So yummy ham and moist turkey..picking up ham because we are celebrating our Thanksgiving on Sunday. ... (living las vegas ..everyone in casino industry works on holidays )

Let me start off by saying I am not a fan of sandwhiches. I never have been. My husband and I decided to come here because he absolutely loves sandwiches and he has been here once before. The lady we encountered named Gione was so friendly. Apparently the Yelp offer was only suppose to be for California but she gave it to us anyway. You can tell the workers here really enjoy their jobs and have fantastic customer service.  Now on to the food. Just for my husband I decided to try a sandwich. I got the turkey pesto and he got the classic ham. WOW! SOOOOO GOOD. Honestly if all sandwiches tasted like this I would eat them all the time.  We will be back to the Honeybaked ham. Quality food and outstanding customer service.

Horrible management , I've never seen a manager tell an older lady that she was going to escort her out with security because of the huge mistake this honey baked ham made.   If you've visited honey baked ham during the holidays , you will know the lines can get extremely long. Luckily my daughter and I got there when the line wasn't outside the door. I called ahead of time and was told 20minutes in and out , I didn't mind the wait until a young employee yelled if you have cash come to my line . The manager then stepped in stating if you broke line please go back to your previous spot,NOW who in their right mind would leave the front and go back to the end ? Right ...   A numerous unhappy customers spoke up stating that it was unfair that the individuals that were waiting had to wait longer because a huge group were allowed to jump line . Instead of the rightfully unhappy customers being taken care of , the crowd that skipped were given customer service.   30min later I arrived to the front, so my 20mim wait became 50mins . I would to commend the young man at the register for being very polite and helpful, Buck , you exemplified great service to me . You saved this dramatic visit to honey baked ham.

Who doesn't like Honeybaked Ham? Every holiday season I can't wait for leftovers to make sandwiches.   I never considered going here out of holiday because I didn't know they make sandwiches or sell by the pound or small hams until recently! Grabbed a Classic Honeybaked sandwich was rather sizeable croissant sandwich and was pretty darn satisfying. I like the honey mustard dressing they put on it.... I should have purchased a bottle. Now that I've had that, It makes perfect sense to serve that on the holidays too.  This is close to the house, I will definitely be coming back for another sandwich soon and a mini ham.

Fast friendly service! sandwich was really good, and large, saved half for dinner. Restaurant was clean and service was quick. Location was easy to find and parking was convenuently right outside the door.

Where do I start, well, let me just make this short and simple....  We had ordered from them the delivery/ catering option to be delivered on the 24th for a Christmas eve party.    40 guests were invited, that's right 40, and would you believe it, they never show up!!!! I mean, no phone call, nothing, the plans  and evenings of 40 HUMAN BEINGS, customers, potential customers, WERE NOT FED and this is on CHRISTMAS EVE for a party, not that easy to just change plans.  And can you believe as the hosts how we felt, this was beyond something terrible, this was a Christmas Nightmare!!! This place was even called the day before at 2:00 to verify the order.  No excuses on this one.    Places like this, who could even possibly do this to their customers, or fail to deliver in this fashion, there should be a law against this, this was just wrong, beware people, on just principle I would say this place in not worthy of ones business, after this incident, I am left speechless, it caused soo much stress and heartache, unbelievable...

If you're a part of my family you know that no holiday is complete without a Honey Baked Ham.  We came in here to purchase a ham for Easter and I was really surprised by everything they had to offer other than ham! All these delicious looking condiments and RUM CAKE!   It took us awhile because we had to look at everything they were selling. Eventually we picked out three different style condiments; Spicy Chipotle Mayo, Honey Mustard Mayo and Horseradish Sauce.   We arrived at the counter and asked the gentleman a couple questions about the ham we wanted to purchase. He said he was a new employee and would find out the answers for us. I really appreciate that he was willing to step away and help a customer other than just attend to the register.  He came back with the answers we needed and we decided to buy an 8 pounder.   As always the service we received was fantastic and the ham tastes delicious! I would like to come back here to try some of the sandwiches they have to offer, and buy a rum cake!

The ham we got was fantastic. Tons of flavor, virtually melts in your mouth. Great for the family dinner and goes great with pineapple and their honey mustard. Also makes for the best leftovers and sandwiches. 5/5

Quick bite spot for lunch. Great friendly staff who care. Once I realized this was an eat-in place I knew it would become a regular in my lunch break places. You gotta try all the sandwiches and breads.

I love honey baked ham so I decided to come here.  I ordered 1/2 sandwich and cup of soup and my wife ordered cup of soup for 14 dollars.  Do you remember the old Wendy's commercials that used to say, "where's the beef"?.  Well just substitute ham.  There were three tiny pieces of ham on the sandwich.  I was so disappointed.  I guess for that price I was expecting a chompies size sandwich.  Now I have to go to Wendy's because I am still hungry.

POLICY & Customer Service Sucks!  My mom ordered in advance and when it was time for her to pick it up. The cashier said they cannot find the list of her orders.  The belgian chocolate  mousse, 1 whole boneless ham, mac and cheese and mash potato she ordered all of this and never got any of it. Not even one!   So there is NO USE ORDERING IN ADVANCE! YOU WILL NOT GET WHAT YOU ORDERED!  You are just wasting your time and it will ruined your whole day!

Just tried this place for the first time and it is awesome. Food is fresh and delicous and the staff is kind and friendly. Oddly enough im not a fan of ham but it delicious and they also have oven roasted and smoked turkey if your not into ham either. The turkey is amazing.

I've ordered hams from Honeybaked over the years and they are the best hams I've ever eaten.  They have a brown sugar candied coating on the outside that makes them sweet and tasty.  The meat is smoked for hours and is perfectly cooked.  Then they slice the ham perfectly so it is easy to serve on plates or sandwiches, eat, and store.  I've never had better ham than Honeybaked.  This Thanksgiving, in addition to brining and cooking our own turkey, we purchased a 2.5lb turkey breast from Honeybaked.  They perform a very similar process on the turkey as they do with their hams.  The turkey had that smoky flavor, a smoke ring, and that yummy brown sugar coating on the outside.  It was delicious.  Now, if I had to choose between a Honeybaked ham and a Honeybaked turkey for my last meal on earth, I'm going to choose the ham, hands down!

When I walked in not one person was in there. (my kinda place!). I'd never been in there before and was craving a sandwich. I got the Ham & Turkey Pesto sandwich. Ham, Smoked Turkey, provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato, red onion and pesto aioli on multigrain flatbread. When I got home I was surprised it wasn't wrapped in fancy logo wrapping. I LIKED THAT! It made me feel like a kid again. Immediately it took me back to when my mom would make my lunch for my field trip and it was always a yummy surprise. I took a bite and it was delicious! The ham was like my moms ham on Thanksgiving! It's so sweet and candy-like. I didn't add any of my own "fixin's" to this sandwich which is a huge plus. The staff was super friendly and gave me a tour of the menu as well as samples if I liked. I love this place!

This place is awful. Go somewhere else. The sandwich was not good and was expensive. We didn't even finish our food. Also, they were out of a lot of things that we wanted and that we saw people come in to buy.

For a bran new point of business pretty well organized.  The manager on duty and I pologize for not remembering her name knew everything and answered every question the new staff member had.  Picked up a couple hams for the holidays and they were excellent like Honeybaked hams always are.

My review is based on the sandwiches and this place never disappoints! My personal favorite is the classic turkey sandwich, as everything is always very fresh and flavorful. You must try the mandarin pineapple salad, it's so simple yet so delicious! The ladies working behind the counter are always so nice, cheerful, and make you feel very welcome.

Yes I do not eat meat- no this place doesn't have much for a vegetarian. But I am not one to judge based on bias food needs. I think this place has great sandwiches (which you can personalize) and great sides. A little pricey (2$ for a can of Cola and 2$ for a small cup of potato salad) but pretty darn good.  The snickerdoodle cookies are to die for, and they have all manner of types of chips and sides to go with whatever you are in need of.   I will try a cheese sandwich one of these days, with the yummy tater salad!

I visited on a Wednesday.  The rotational soup is Creamy Chicken & Wild Rice. There are different soups on different days. The creamy chicken soup was savory with the delicious spices and wild rice.  Also, I got a classic smoked turkey  sandwich with a creamy honey mustard. It was very tasty.  The pickles are good too.  Also, the server lady was very sweet and made my visit a pleasure.

Not impressed. Customer service we received wasn't up to par -- guy wasnt able to answer simple questions regarding products they sell. Spoke with store manager who took care of the situation really well, but not blown away with their products. Ended up throwing a Turkey in our roaster bc everyone was disappointed on Thxgiving :/

Customer service was good, but my sandwich was not.  I had roast beef and cheddar and it came on a croissant.  The croissant was like a brick.  The roast beef did not taste very good to me, and they forgot to put the cheddar cheese on it. Way too much horseradish sauce. So I really didn't eat much of it.

The meatloaf sucks!  We love their ham, sandwiches and sides, but  yesterday my wife bought a meatloaf and side of loaded mashed potatoes from Honeybaked Ham.  What a horrible meal.  The meatloaf is dense and has a thick layer of ketchup.  When I say dense, I mean it is about the size and density of a brick.  The taste was not actually bad (once you get past the ketchup), but texture is something I just could not adjust to.  The mashed potatoes -loaded style- had bacon, chunks of potato, and probably sour cream and cheese.  Not suited to my taste.   I will buy from them again, just will stick to the ham!

This was our first time in the store. It is so clean, bright and airy.  Kelvin helped me select my sandwich. Which was the Tavern. Absolutely delicious. I loved the sauce on the delicious multi grain bread.  The ham salad was made with TLC and was delicious as well.  We also met another gentleman with a fabulous voice. He should be on the radio.  I am sorry that his name slipped my mind.  We will definitely be back.  They have a great Valentine day special!!!   Dawn

Like so many others, I visited this Honeybaked location late in the evening on the Thursday before Christmas. I was expecting a madhouse. Maybe my timing was just perfect, because it was a very brief wait. I have never bought a ham from Honeybaked (or a Christmas ham at ALL, for that matter!) so I had lots of questions. The gal who helped me, I believe named Erica, was a superstar. She was patient, knowledgeable and friendly. She never made me feel like my questions were silly and never once rushed me. She seemed enthusiastic to pick out a perfect ham for my needs and when an employee takes such pride in their product, it really resonates with you.  The store was clean, well-organized and prepared to handle the influx of holiday traffic. Even at that late hour on Dec 22, they still appeared to have plenty of inventory.  I selected a perfect 5 lb bone-in ham for about $40 and it was an excellent choice. The family was happy with the ham and I was happy there were leftovers!

So I have driven past this HoneyBaked location I don't even know how many times, but decided to actually stop and have lunch.  Our family has really enjoyed the high quality specialty ham and turkey (among other things) that they offer, mainly during the holiday season.  No, this is not your garden variety type of meat; it's definitely higher-end, and the quality shows.  I decided on their Ham Classic sandwich ($6.49) on a flaky croissant with the basic toppings of tomato, lettuce, mustard.  The sandwich was very tasty and the ham...oh yes...really delicious as I remember. Super Yum! Maybe I'll order their turkey or even ham salad the next time I stop.  I of course Checked-In as they were offering a free soda and bag of chips, but the cashier didn't know what I was talking about, so I explained how it usually works.  The manager said, "We don't do Yelp, but I will go ahead and give you the chips and soda for free.  The SKU on Yelp doesn't work in our system; not every store honors Yelp."  Ok, thanks manager, much appreciated.  I found the store/caf√© to be clean and bright, with various ads showcasing their specialties.  The various employees were helpful and seemed to enjoy their jobs.

I was craving a Honey Baked Ham sandwich and since it is close, I had to satisfy my palate.  So glad I did. Everything about that sandwich was perfect. The croissant, the meat (for sure), the mayo (they mix it there), the honey mustard, and the fresh lettuce and tomato. Oh my...I want another one...

Ordered the daily special, asked not to have sprouts on the sandwich and they said they couldn't eliminate anything from the sandwich. Not the first time this happened . They need to step up their customer service!

Costco now sells really good Honey Baked Hams.  and if you have never had a REAL HONEY BAKED HAM as in FROM HONEYBAKED HAM Co. on Cactus Rd then you can't die just yet.  You must at least once in your life have one from here.  I only buy them around holidays like Christmas and I have to wait in a big ass long line just to pick the ham up.  You must  pre-order your ham in advance to guarantee you get one for Christmas!    So as I stand in the line, I tell myself that it would be so much better if I just decided to buy a ham in September sometime, or in July-- but I forget.  Not that waiting in the line is so bad, they have lots of free samples of food and there are usually nice people around you to make conversation with- ever so often an angry husband who must not have  know what he was getting himself into when he said "sure- I'll run and pick up the ham, honey".  So this ham..... it is this perfect crunchy outer sugary glaze that just makes my mouth water thinking about it.  You need to go to Honeybaked Ham. Like FOR REAL.

After enjoying a Honey Baked Ham last Christmas, we decided to get one this year, instead of Turkey. I stopped in today, a little after 12:00 and was greeted by a friendly staff ready to answer any questions, make recommendations and show you a variety of hams, turkeys ( roasted or smoked ) to allow you to pick the one you want. I chose my ham, while I enjoyed the turkey samples they had available and was out the door. The staff was friendly, gave great service and I know we will enjoy our Christmas diner thanks to Honey Baked Ham.

They forgot to put a salad in our order and we didn't notice it until we got home. We went back to retrieve are missing salad and they gave us lip. They tried to tell us we had our salad! Then without any apologies they said well okay. Sandwiches that we had eaten already we're mediocre-at-best. But the lack of service is what will keep us away.

I love the food here. But what made my experience five-stars was the service I received while ordering and dining in. The staff are very friendly. I eat here occasionally and will likely be back sooner than usual!

Who doesn't like Honey Baked Ham?  I thought this is where you bought whole hams for holidays, never knew it had a Cafe inside.  Glad we stopped in.  I had a classic ham sandwich with soup. Bother were awesome! Price was a little higher than other places, but I didn't feel like it was too high considering the quality of the food.  I was disappointed in the fact that they were having problems with the soda machine. When we told them about it they said they knew about it already. I would of thought if it was an ongoing problem them should fix it rather than leave it that way. It was the Coke, Mr. Pibb, and Diet coke. That's a shame. I would have added a star if that would of been taken care of in the 30 minutes we sat and ate out lunch :/  Food was good,  wish maybe they would shave the ham, or maybe thinner so it's not so big on the sandwich.  We will come back again and see if any changes are made :)

I use to think that Honeybaked Ham only sold Ham products so I never bothered because I dont eat beef or pork. When I found out they sell turkey products I was so happy. I actually got a sample when they had a booth in Ballantyne. I take my son here often and they know us. I went alone one day and couldnt remember exactly what he usually gets and the lady says I know what he gets LOL that was pretty awesome on top of the fact that they pile the meat on the sandwich and the slices are thick! They are not cheap and its awesome! Definitely a thumbs up, matter fact Im do for a sandwich soon LOL
Eh, their chicken salad wasn't anything special.  Not horrible, but not really worth going out of your way for either.  Maybe next time I'll try the ham.  Lol.

Great place to get a sandwich for lunch that actually tastes good and makes you enjoy eating it. The ham and turkey are awesome and they never disappoint. Staff is friendly and quick. You must take some home and use the bone from the ham to make the split pea soup mix they sell. SOOO good!

We haven't been to honey baked ham in forever.  This particular one was a great experience.  We came in for lunch and they weren't busy. I don't know why. The food was delicious and all the employees were friendly and accommodating.    Charmaine immediately greeted us on entering and handed us a menu explaining everything.   The potato soup was fresh, hot and spot on for soup!!  The croissants were fantastic and I had chicken salad on mine. It was so satisfying and filling.  My husband got ham on his croissant sandwich and said it was delicious as well.   They were quick at preparing and serving out meals. The establishment was very clean and inviting.    If you check in you get a free drink and bag chips!! Can't beat that because a sandwich and soup is $8 plus a free bag of chips and drink.    They have many meals to take home and cook too!!

My first time in a honey baked ham store. I just needed a ham bone and didn't see one at my local grocer so I gave this place a try. They had them - a whole freezer full of them. They have a set up where you buy the bone, buy a packet of soup mix and just add water to make one of three soups: Mixed Bean, White Bean or Split Pea.  I was the only one in the store, but the associate was great. I was welcomed right upon walking in. The associate was friendly, volunteered cooking tips and was forthcoming with product details.   The ham bones were around 4.5lb / $10. They were frozen and were supposed to be used within 5 days of thawing. The store associate said she has made soup with them still frozen though.   The bone itself had a lot of meat on it. The store associate said it would fall apart when cooked and add meat and flavor to the dish. (I didn't have a pot big enough to fit the bone plus my soup ingredients so I ended up removing some of the meat before cooking.)   I'll definitely give this place a try in the future. You can also just stop in here for a lunch sandwich.

I was looking for a w lunch spot while out shopping.  This cafe came to mind. I was greeted quickly by the cashier. She was quick and friendly.  I ordered the classic ham sandwich with a few custom requests. I ordered it plain- no mayo or honey mustard and on wheat bread instead of a croissant. The cashier had no problem customizing my sandwich.  Greatly appreciated!   The sandwich was yummy! Real ham off the bone. Im glad I ordered it plain because I tried the packet of honey mustard and was it gross! Too sweet and more like ham glaze! Not good uncooked.  I also checked in and used the free chips and drink offer! Thanks Yelp!

Thanksgiving shopping is DONE! We went to HoneyBaked early Sunday afternoon and got the ham and the turkey and a few fixings. Very helpful staff who walked us through what we wanted and helped us determine the right quantities. It sure isn't cheap though!  This stuff doesn't have to be bought the day before, ya know? You can get it a little earlier because the line tends to grow as the holidays approach.

Ok I officially love the guys who work here!! Completely amazing customer service!!! I gotta say I can be a pretty picky eater and usually ask to change at least one thing about a menu item. Ya, servers see me and run!!!  I ordered the prime roast beef and they switched out the cheese, bread, and took off the condiments, and even heated it for me!!! All while joking with me and my friend, and they even brought the order over to our table. I wish I could remember their names! My friend ordered one of the ham clubs and he also really liked it. These sandwiches are soo good! And will keep you full all day. I'm coming back for the salads and soup!:)
I love this place. I like the classic ham sandwich. The food is yummy. You can buy sides when you don't cook. You get a stamp card for free food. Plus, they are always super nice.
Got a ham from them for my employees and they just loved it so much they brought me some.  Plan on going back soon.

I always wait unit the last minute to get the Christmas Ham, Turkey, or whatever it is I need. Even if it is just a bottle of their delicious mustard, or mayo, you are airing a good 20 min before even entering the place. The line wraps all around the building. That is only after you sit an additional ten minutes in the parking lot line waiting for a spot to open up. It is eel worth it though their spiral honey hams are very toothsome to say the least.   For being so hectic and insane due to the holidays, the staff is still really cool and pleasant.   I really do not come here except for Christmas. Although I am a man of tradition, next year I will definitely try to break my tradition of coming here last minute. I suggest you do the same.

OK so this Christmas I decided to make things easy for myself in the cooking department, considering I just cooked a full on feast for Thanksgiving.  I decided to have a Honeybaked ham for my Christmas dinner and I will make all of the delicious sides which would be simple!  The Ham was delicious, picked it up the day before Christmas, yes waited in a 40 minute line, I was expecting that so no shock, lol.  It was $38 bucks for a ham that fed 8 people a generous portion, I think it was a great deal for taste, price and convenience.  You don't even have to bake or heat it up, simply pull it out and let it rest for an hour and you are ready to go. That is key that you serve this ham at room temperature!  I suggest making your own sides as they are costly and in my opinion their sides are not as good as what you can do on your own. They are called Honeybaked ham for a reason and that is what you should buy :)  All I had to do was my sides, green beans and bacon, brown sugar baked yams, and scalloped potatoes. It was an easy Holiday dinner and it left a lot more time for talking, snapping pics and laughing with family and friends!  I will be doing a repeat of this next year for my Christmas dinner!!!  I am a very happy customer!

Ordered a ham and pie for Thanksgiving.  I arrived as soon as they opened the day before Thanksgiving to find that there were only about 5 people in line and they didn't pre-purchase online, I had, so I walked straight to the front of the purchased online line.  I was in and out in 5 minutes.  Customer service was friendly and helpful and of course everyone enjoyed the ham I served.  Should I ever be crazy enough to host Thanksgiving again, I will be back!

This by far has the freshest ingredients available for any luncheon.  The staff here has excellent customer service and they always have treated me like family. My company uses them a few times during the year for catering and everyone loves their sandwiches.

I will never go back to this location. They are ripping people off and they say it's ok. They charge an extra city tax on all of their items.  I will now go to the Phoenix HoneyBaked ham store and wait in a longer line. Disgusting.
The food was excellent as were most of the staff. The guy who took my order was very curt, borderline rude. Put him in another position and this place is a great lunch spot!

We ordered ham last thanksgiving .. And I love this place we order every year when we were in the southwest side of town... We're new here in northwest but quality should always be similar... The ham was a very salty ;( my family barely ate it and we spent 60$ it got wasted ..

Worst online order system ever.  Let me order a ham for new years eve for pickup after four.  Showed up at 4:17 and it was closed!!!  And the worst thing was not one person from the store called me to make me aware.  I understand that they close early but their online system should reflect pickup times that are correct according to holiday hours.  Rude Manager and unhelpful.
This is a nice place for a quick and delicious sandwich. The broccoli salad was very good too, its balanced well. Very yummy.
I came in all they had was ham and turkey. I came all the way from unlv. I am very disappointed; no soup no nothing
